title: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw
summary: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw (born 23 March 1953) is an Indian billionaire entrepreneur.[2] She is the executive chairperson and founder of Biocon Limited and Biocon Biologics Limited,[3] a biotechnology company based in Bangalore, India[4] and the former chairperson of Indian Institute of Management, Bangalore.[5] In 2014, she was awarded the Othmer Gold Medal for outstanding contributions to the progress of science and chemistry.[6][7][8][9][10] She is on the Financial Timesâ€™ top 50 women in business list.[11] In 2019, she was listed as the 68th most powerful woman in the world by Forbes.[12] She was named EY World Entrepreneur Of The Year 2020.[13] She is married to John Shaw.[14]
